The Ohio Department of Health Interim Director, Lance Himes, has signed a health order that requires reporting notification of COVID-19 cases in Ohio K-12 schools. We are required to have a system in place for reporting confirmed Coronavirus cases. If your child tests positive for Coronavirus, you will need to call: 740-498-1616.

Please leave your child’s name, date of birth, grade level and school building they attend, as well as the date of the positive test and the date of symptom onset.

The only individuals checking this phone line are Mr. Staggs and Nurse Abby. We are required to notify both the Health Department as well as make information about a positive case publicly available to our Trojan families without disclosing protected health information of the individual who tests positive.

In summary, if your child tests positive for Coronavirus, please call 740-498-1616 to make the school aware.

Thank you for your cooperation and understanding in regards to the guidance we must follow to keep our doors open here at Newcomerstown Schools.

Dear Parents,
School attendance is of the upmost importance, but keeping students healthy and engaged in learning is equally as important. In order to do this we are asking for your help:

1. If your child is sick, please keep them home. Do not try and send them back to school when they are ill, fevered or clearly sick. This includes extracurricular activities.
2. If your child is fevered, please do not send them back to school until they are fever free for 24 hours without the use of over-the-counter medications.
3. Please talk to your child about the importance of hand washing and cough/sneeze etiquette (coughing into their arms instead of their hand or not covering at all).

Each school is disinfecting high traffic areas daily. Our staff is reinforcing hand washing as well as cough and sneeze etiquette throughout the school day.
Thank you for your help in promoting health and wellness in the school setting. As always, please feel free to call me with any questions or concerns.
-Nurse Abby

A Quick Note About Our Auto Dial System:

Parents who wish to receive calls from the school auto dial system on their cell phones must not have a ring back tone (music on hold) enabled for incoming calls. Our system mistakes the music as an answer and tries to play the recording prematurely.

If you are receiving calls and do not wish to continue receiving calls please contact the Board of Education offices at 740-498-8373 and leave your name and number. The numbers in our system are generated from student emergency medical forms and other parent submitted information. Typos do occur during data entry. Please let us know if you should no longer receive calls.
